abstract: The comments were in response to reports that Google and Verizon were near a deal for faster service.
snippet: The comments were in response to reports that Google and Verizon were near a deal for faster service.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission said Thursday that he believed it was “unacceptable” for Internet service providers to offer faster Internet transmission to content providers willing to pay higher fees.

headline.main: F.C.C. Chief Opposes Fees for Internet Priority
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Chief Opposes Fees For Priority On the Web
